body_html: There is no assumption that the array is contiguous in from_numpy. But it seems that there is one extra byte that was added to the numpy array that can be handled by numpy (because the strides are specified in bytes), but that can't be handled by pytorch (because the strides are handled wrt the data type size). I think a copy is necessary here
body_text: There is no assumption that the array is contiguous in from_numpy. But it seems that there is one extra byte that was added to the numpy array that can be handled by numpy (because the strides are specified in bytes), but that can't be handled by pytorch (because the strides are handled wrt the data type size). I think a copy is necessary here
body: There is no assumption that the array is contiguous in `from_numpy`. But it seems that there is one extra byte that was added to the numpy array that can be handled by numpy (because the strides are specified in bytes), but that can't be handled by pytorch (because the strides are handled wrt the data type size). I think a copy is necessary here
